page.title: 11Dialect in Evie
page.content: There are still many dialect words and phrases in common use, many being derived from the strong Norse influence in Orkney's history. People speak with a strong accent. The following are a few of the most common dialect words:{peedie}- small,{ {blot}-basin of water,{uncan}-strange or unfamiliar,{beesom}-floor brush,{ {peelie wallie}-ill,{press}-cupboard,{ {switter}-spill,{swadge}-digest awhile, {plicko}-torch,{gutter}-mud.{ The following are some of the phrases {I doubt it}-I agree,{weel ammas}-well deserved,{dainty grain}-considerable amount,{scuddling claes}-visiting clothes but not dress,{ill-thrawn}- cantankerous,{gaiy fair}-rather poor. Undoubtedly, due to communications, education and incoming people, dialect and accent are becoming less in the younger generation.
